Pro tip, run the turret traverse mod that gives 15% faster traverse for only a 5% reload reduction (.25 seconds). After EM, the 180 is down to 18 seconds which isn't bad at all. And BFT brings the reload back down under 5 seconds.

Well you have to look at the average damage per ship as compared to others. Just like any stat, really.

Which is also not a reliable way of measuring effectiveness. For example, as a cruiser, if you focus on killing DDs, your damage will be lower than someone that burns BBs all day, but you may be helping your team win more.
It's best to look at all the stats, which is where something like WTR comes in handy.

Generally, if you know there's a DD around you don't try and smoke up until they're neutralized. But there's basically always a situation in battle (either ranked or random) where being smoked up is very useful. My div mates and I do this regularly in randoms and my 80% winrate over the past month speaks for itself.
That's what I just said.
Well, there's certainly good times for it and bad times. Luckily Bismarcks have hydro so it's less of an issue for them.

WRITING.TITLE: PSA: DDs smoking up their allies is a game winning strategy.
WRITING.TEXT:
Often there is a single BB that gets focused first, if you can smoke them up when they're under heavy fire, that's a huge swing. I know it can be difficult to coordinate with randoms, but just something to keep in mind/look out for. Using your smoke screens for more than just yourself is a huge advantage and something that is often utilized in clan vs clan battles.
Just look out for torps.
That is all.

Not that MM isn't rough right now for T5/6, but each team should have the same tiering of ships. Meaning if you're contributing as much as the enemy's low tiers, your chance to win should be 50%. Barring just really unluckily bad teams all night long, if you're losing more games than not you aren't contributing enough.
Like I said, T5/6 MM is rough right now, but just because you're low tier, doesn't mean you chance to win is any less than the other team. Get some div mates to make it less painful. There's still ways to contribute as lowest tier. Good play goes a long way and most T6s have stuff to bring to th4 table. This is not WoT.

Hey! Thanks for taking your time to answer questions, I have 2!
Firstly, are there any plans to rework captain retraining? As it is, I feel it's the only "unfair" element to the free to play model in the game as with high tier captains, it's completely unrealistic to retrain a captain to a new ship without forking over money. I know WG is a business, but as someone who is willing to spend good money on this game (I have so many premium ships) it still doesn't feel good.
Speaking of high tier captains, is there a plan to raise the cap on captain points? I have several 18 point captains and I often find myself with like 1 or 2 points left over that go to waste. Raising the cap to19 would open several new build opportunities that I have seen . Since 19 is currently kind of a joke to get to currently.
Thanks for your time!
Would pay real money for this tbh
